intro: Lunathyrium changbeiense, commonly known as the Changbei grass, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
